metadata.title: CVE-2022-25314 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5, there is an integer overflow incopyString.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.5-2
libexpat1 - 2.4.5-2
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.5-2').
xmlrpc-c package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tdom package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
